reviews.text: On arrival the owner was more than helpful sorting out our room. The room was large and clean with everything you needed plus more. Even though it's above a pub, was actually very quiet as the road is practically a dead end apart from the train station. The highlight was the breakfast. It was a gorgeous morning so we asked to take breakfast in the garden as it was stunning. It was all arranged for us once we'd come back from a walk and it was the best breakfast in a B&B i'd ever had. Everything was spot on, all freshly cooked and no cheap sausages, can't stand a cheap sausage. Will be returning without a doubt when visiting Lymington again.
reviews.title: Worth returning for the 1st class full English in the morn!!

reviews.text: I stayed here with my best man and groomsman the night before my wedding and cannot compliment the place enough. We were instantly made to feel welcome and they allowed us a late check out so that we could get ready for the wedding. Sandwiches were also provided before we left for the ceremony and although we'd asked for these when booking, the fact they were ready to go without having to ask on the day meant it was one less thing to worry about! Breakfast was also good quality. If you are looking for a clean, cosy, affordable, well-located hotel with great service in Lymington then look no further than The Bosun's Chair.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in an ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent accommodation, wonderful welcome and always the best of attention,will definitely be back as soon as possible and will recommend this hotel to all my friends.The cask ales were first class, and the nearby railway station is very convenient.
reviews.title: A wonderful four days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Bosun's Chair whilst visiting family this week. What an excellent find! Accommodation and breakfast excellent - fabulous garden at the back for an evening drink on a summers evening - highly recommmend for the value.
reviews.title: Very good.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend!!
reviews.title: Wouldn't know - did not end up staying

reviews.text: we recently stayed here the weekend,very comfortable accommodation,great hosts,lovely breakfasts too!of all the bars&gastro pubs in lymington we found the bosuns to be the least pretentious&best value,a DEFINATE return!lovley garden,next door to the train station so ideal for travelling,nice quiet street 2min from town centre,spot on!
reviews.title: best pub in lymington!!

reviews.text: The owners Russ @ Kelly and staff, made us very welcome on arrival and throughout our 4 night stay, the room was spotlessly clean, the view onto the beer garden from bedroom window absolutley wonderful, can,t wait to go back hope to get the same bedroom. So handy for the town and the Quay just a few minutes walk, would definitley recommend the Bosuns Chair for a short break "FANTASTIC" Thanks for making our stay so welcome luv from Mari and Trev xx
reviews.title: "Fabulous Stay"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a great overnight stay at this lovely little pub hotel. Rooms were simply furnished but very clean and comfortable. Pub downstairs was warm and welcoming and has a beautiful garden where you can sit outside. In the morning we had a hearty breakfast that filled us for the day as we set off to sail in the Solent. All in all it was a perfect place to stay for the night and enjoy the charming seaside town of Lymington.
reviews.title: Charming little inn!

reviews.text: From the warm welcome from the moment we entered the place, to the beautifully maintained garden, and the very comfortable, very clean room -we were not disappointed in a single thing at this great place. Can't recommend it highly enough. Just tried to rebook for antoher stay..but word is obviously getting around - fully booked for the weekend we wanted. My advice....don't delay...book quick!
reviews.title: A jewel of a place - we will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stumbled across the Bosun's chair by accident when we were looking for somewhere to stay for a couple of nights. What a stroke of luck that we found it! The owners and staff made a huge effort and really added something special to what was already a great weekend. As others have said, the breakfast was excellent - freshly cooked, locally sourced, high quality ingredients – what’s not to love? I understand they'll be doing more food as they settle into what is a relatively new venture for them. This is a pub with rooms - so if you're looking for a boutique hotel, maybe it's not for you. However, if you're looking for a really well run, welcoming place to stay which is slap in the middle of Lymington and where the staff treat you like you really matter, you won't be disappointed. I've stopped in a lot of very expensive hotels where the overall experience has been nowhere near as positive as the Bosun's Chair. Good luck with the place guys - and don't change a thing! We'll be back soon.
reviews.title: Excellent, Family Run Place - Don't Change A Thing!

reviews.text: If you are looking very a clean well run bed and breakfast in Dorset then I can recommend this lovely pub. Set just off the high street it is very convenient for a stop in Lymington. The pub has a car park and a lovely beer garden and it was just a shame that the weather was not good enough to enjoy it. It is a minute walk to the high st and there are numerous The room that we stayed in was small but very clean and comfortable . It had an en suite and tea and coffee facilities . The pub did offer food but they specialised in pies which looked delicious but we didnt try them . Breakfast was served in the bar downstairs and was freshly cooked to order . All the staff we met were very helpful and friendly I would definatley consider a return visit .
reviews.title: Very friendly B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bosuns chair was set in an excellent location near to the town centre and had free parking.
reviews.title: Bosuns chair

reviews.text: This was a 1 night stop for ourselves as traveling to the isle of wight (ferry terminal across the road) .
reviews.title: Lovely service and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was excellent and very clean and also the bathroom was spotless.
reviews.title: Great location for Lymington centre

reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable and little shampoo's and soaps available with tea and coffee facilites available , nice views out of window and quiet at night .
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night over Easter and this was the perfect location to enjoy Lymington and the local area. As most other reports allude to, we were made very welcome from the owners and the breakfast was made to order and very tasty. We would recommend for anyone who wants to be near the high street and have friendly service.
reviews.title: Easter treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A perfect retreat for a few days rest. Made to feel very welcome by Kelly & Russel. The room #1 on first floor was clean comfortable and quiet. Nothing was to much trouble. Breakfast was fresh cooked to order along with one of the best sausages I have ever tried. Out the back is a very nice garden which is private and not overlooked. At the end of the day you can have a drink in the bar or a coffee in a relaxed atmosphere. And with the best weeks weather for six months provided free of charge a very pleasant stay. Thank you both Kelly & Russel.
reviews.title: Perfect. J&Dnorthant's

reviews.text: My two nieces from Japan booked a twin room on the internet for two nights from 6th January. After a 13 hour flight and their aunt's funeral and wake we arrived at the pub at 5pm to be told by the barman that there were no twins available but they could share the double bed or he would put a mattress on the floor.
reviews.title: More like walking the plank

reviews.text: There were no lights on the stairs to the room, and no attempt was made to book them in on arrival. The room itself was shabby and dated. There appears to be no residents lounge and the bar area was crowded with male drinkers.
reviews.title: Roomy, conveniently located, very pleasant stay

reviews.text: I was not happy with this arrangement and booked them into a lovely twin bedded room at the Stanwell House Hotel around the corner. Despite the lack of twin bedded accommodation and the fact that the room was not used at all the barman at the Bosuns Chair insisted on payment in full for the 2 nights (£140, without breakfasts). What a welcome to England!
reviews.title: Completely outstanding in all respects
